name: Roasted Tomato Basil Soup
headline: Roasted Tomato Basil Soup
description: Serve Ina Garten's Roasted Tomato Basil Soup recipe, made with canned and fresh plum tomatoes, for an elegant starter from Barefoot Contessa on Food Network.

image.description: Ina Garten Roasted Tomato Basil Soup
Ina Garten Roasted Tomato Basil Soup
Ina Garten Roasted Tomato Basil Soup

keywords: Easy Appetizer,Appetizer,Easy,Tomato Soup,Vegetable Soup,Soup,Tomato,Vegetable,Roasted Vegetable,Roasting,Roasted Tomato,Vegetarian,Low Calorie,Low-Fat,Sauteing Recipes,Recipes for a Crowd,Gluten Free
recipeIngredient: 3 pounds ripe plum tomatoes, cut in half lengthwise
1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons good olive oil
1 (28-ounce) canned plum tomatoes, with their juice

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Toss together the tomatoes, 1/4 cup olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread the tomatoes in 1 layer on a baking sheet and roast for 45 minutes.

In an 8-quart stockpot over medium heat, saute the onions and garlic with 2 tablespoons of olive oil, the butter, and red pepper flakes for 10 minutes, until the onions start to brown. Add the canned tomatoes, basil, thyme, and chicken stock. Add the oven-roasted tomatoes, including the liquid on the baking sheet. Bring to a boil and simmer uncovered for 40 minutes. Pass through a food mill fitted with the coarsest blade. Taste for seasonings. Serve hot or cold.

review.reviewBody: Ina nails it everything. The simple blending of a few ingredients that are packed with amazing flavor. Roasted peppers are a great variation that also helps to thicken soup just a bit.

I have made this soup for years! It is always a huge hit with everyone, including my kids (now 5&6). The soup freezes beautifully, too. The comment I have regarding the recipe ingredients is that 1 TBS of salt can be A LOT. I start with 1.5 teaspoons and adjust as I go, once the tomatoes are added to the pot with the broth, canned tomatoes and onions. Love serving the soup with a side of grilled cheese. Cheeses in the sandwich I love are p‚Äôtit basque, d‚Äôaffinois double cr√®me and sharp cheddar on sourdough (grilled with a good amount of butter!). Love cutting into little bite-sized pieces and throwing in the soup little little croutons.

This is an absolutely delish soup- lots of layers of flavors achieved fairly easily. I followed recipe exactly - my ONLY complaint is that the soup is very thin. I actually watched the video post recipe production to see if it was me or if that was the style of the soup. So- it's a thin soup. Served it with Rye & Smoked Gouda grilled cheese sammies- believe me everyone loved it. I'm going to try with roasted peppers next time and I will either make a cornstarch slurry to thicken the soup at the end or do a riff on the recipe by added some mushrooms (either sliced or whizzed in the food processor-) for some extra texture. Really had to give this recipe 5 stars for flavor and hope the extra deep dive inspires someone to be a touch creative. Thanks Ina!
Love this soup!! Doubled the recipe and froze some for later.
Delicious. A great soup that‚Äôs hearty and dairy free. Next time will peel the tomatoes after roasting. I used an immersion blender but the skins were a nuisance

Excellent recipe! We modified slightly by using slightly overripe cherry tomatoes and a small dollop (about 2oz.) heavy cream at end. Delicious with homemade grilled Gruy√®re cheese sandwiches! Thank you, Ina!

Was searching for a tomato soup recipe with good reviews.  I think roasting the tomatoes gave this soup an extra layer of flavor.  This was so good.  Will make this again. Also, you don't need the cream as this soup was hearty enough.

This was easy and turned out delicious. I personalize the recipe with a teaspoon or so of cumin, 1/2 chopped poblano pepper as a substitution for the red pepper just because I had it, and the rind from a block of Parmigano Reggiano cheese.
Amazing! My family loves‚ù§Ô∏è
This soup is super easy and delicious! It was the first soup I have ever made and it was amazing! Thanks Ina!
Delicious and so healthy! Thank you!

We LOVE this soup! My "personalizations" are the addition of a pound of Campari tomatoes to the roasted tomatoes, three roasted red peppers, one tsp ground cumin, and 1/2 tsp of white pepper. I used a food mill to make short work of getting rid of peels and finished with an immersion blender for smoothness. Serve with toasted aged cheddar cheese sandwiches and it's "Hello Fall... nice to see you!"
This is my go to tomato soup. Roasting the tomatoes adds so much flavor.  I use about 1/2 the basil, but that‚Äôs just preference I usually double the recipe and freeze or can for later.
Just simmering our third batch. This soup is soooooo good. Ina Garten - you‚Äôre a genius!!

We love this recipe. Today was the third time I have made this and doubled the ingredients since we have an abundance from the garden.  The only alteration I made was using an immersion blender and I peeled my tomatoes because it is literally so easy. (I don't like the stringy skins)  I also whisked in about a cup of half and half to give it that hint of creamy tomato texture.  Just my preference.  We will enjoy pulling this out of the freezer when the autumn temps cool down!
This is delicious!  I didn‚Äôt change a thing except to double the recipe since I had lots of fresh tomatoes and basil and froze a couple of quarts for winter.
Thank you all for the immersion blender hack. I bought one, and just finished making the soup. We loved it and will be sharing the extra with our neighbors! (Insert mike drop here). Thank you Ms Ina!

We make this soup throughout the year - doubling and sometimes tripling the recipe, so we can freeze the extras. I love the roasted tomato,  basil, and thyme flavor.   And with mucho basil in the recipe, it‚Äôs perfect for when you have tons of the delicious herb taking over your garden.  This soup base can be changed up in so many ways to make so many other delicious dishes.   Thank you, Ina.
Delish. I used my immersion blender and it turned out almost bisque-like without the cream. Had a nice little kick to it, too. Would definitely make again.

This is a delicious tomato soup. It‚Äôs my go-to when I have fresh basil and thyme from my garden. Four cups is the perfect amount to balance the acidity from the tomatoes. I have used both an immersion blender, which creates a chunky texture, and a food mill for a velvety soup. I can always count on Ina!

This is my ‚Äúgo to‚Äù recipe for great comfort food. This soup is incredible and the recipe is easy to follow. I really never liked tomato soup that much until I made this! I also make it vegan, no butter and vegetable stock‚Ä¶ it still has great flavor!
This recipe is perfect! I thickened with half an avocado to avoid cream. A MAZING !!
Added a half pint of heavy cream after blending. It is so good!
I loved this recipe. I added some milk and creme to make it creamer.

Great tomato soup recipe! Note, this is not a cream based recipe, so don‚Äôt expect that type of result. Overall, I thought this was super flavorful and fairly healthy considering the lack the cream.

Also, no food mill here but I used my immersion blender and the texture was perfect.

Absolutely delicious! I didn‚Äôt have quite 4 cups of basil, but used all other ingredients as listed. I also don‚Äôt have a food mill, so ran through the Vitamix. No need for straining as the tomato skin & seeds blended well. I know it‚Äôs all a matter of preference but I did not see a need to add heavy cream to it, as other commenters did. It‚Äôs already creamy & healthier as written. So I would just suggest tasting it before you add cream & then decide if you want the extra flavor.
The best tomato soup ever!  The fresh basil and thyme is so perfect.  I used my vitamin and loved the little tomato seeds and felt it was perfect in every way.  No straining needed for me.  Love!!

Made this tonight. Wow!!! The best tomato soup I‚Äôve ever had. We made a few additions. I added around 2/3 cup of plain Greek yogurt at the end to cut the acidity. I put a dollop on top with a few shelled pistachios and had some brown rice on the side for any who wanted a carb. A complete and delicious dinner!  Thanks once again Ina!!!!
I‚Äôve made this twice and added a cup of heavy cream at the end of the cooking process! Chef‚Äôs kiss both times thanks Ina!
Best tomato soup I‚Äôve ever made! I love it!

Very good. I roasted the onions and garlic while the tomatoes were roasting. Thought I had basil in my garden, but only had a few leaves so used mostly dried. Blended it all up in my vitamix and added about 1 cup cream.

Convert the fresh basil to 1 cup dry. Thyme also dry (because I had it already).  Added 1 cup of heavy whipped cream for an amazing tomato soup bisque‚Ä¶wow‚Ä¶made some sour dough croutons for dipping too.  Wow good!
Just made this, followed the recipe, except blended it at the end, and did not strain it. I CAN'T STOP EATING IT!!!! I could eat the whole bowl, and so HEALTHY. Thank-you Ina!
This soup is soooo good!   Better than restaurant quality.   I can‚Äôt wait to make it again!!!

As always, Ina gives us a winner. I have made this soup many times and it is always delicious. This time I roasted a whole pod of garlic along with the tomatoes, and then squeezed the beautiful cloves directly into the soup pot after they cooled, but before blending. It added a magnificent depth to the dish with minimal added effort since the oven was on anyway!
This was delicious!  Will admit used dried thyme instead of fresh üò¨‚Ä¶.. thank you Inaüòã
I love this recipe! All the flavors work so beautifully together. The thyme is the big back flavor that gives this soup that special flavor. My go to tomato soup love it.

I too used a combination of plum & cherry tomatoes, because that is what I had around. I only used a small amount of basil, because I just wanted tomato soup. In the end, I food milled half, returned to the pot & used an immersion blender on the entire recipe. Because I am a cream of tomato-lover, I did add a cup of cream to the finished product. I realize what I did was a diversion from the original, but it still turned out beautifully & I would definitely make it again.

Made this recipe three weeks ago with garden tomatoes. Followed recipe exactly. Way too much basil!! Ina Garten ‚Äòs recipes usually can be trusted, however this one was not kitchen tested before publishing. The basil flavor was so strong that you had instant heartburn after a small cup. Also, needed to be strained to remove fresh tomato seeds. Disappointed.
This is my go-to recipe for the oodles of tomatoes grown in my garden. It is SO good. I also can it, so I have lots for the winter!

OMG this is sooooo good.  I roasted fat flavor bomb tomatoes....smaller that plum, so I did add a small can of diced tomatoes to compensate.  Some got a bit charred but it just enhanced the flavor.  I had garden basil and thyme and put it through my blender instead off food mill.  This was the best tomato soup I've ever had.....thank you Ina....keep em coming.

This recipe is amazing.   I‚Äôve made several times and it never disappoints.  Making homemade croutons to serve will take over the top‚Ä¶.not that it isn‚Äôt already over the top.   Tomato soup is not always a favorite of some but this one gets a blue ribbon every time.  Thanks Ina.
A friend shared this with me yesterday as were wondering what to do with our bounty of backyard basil and tomatoes! Excellent suggestion and recipe.

Good recipe, especially with all that delicious basil. I tried using the food mill but I didn't want to lose the basil and garlic so I switched to an immersion blender. I guess you could put just the tomatoes through the food mill and then add the aromatics but the blender worked great. I also just used homegrown tomatoes so it didn't make much soup but I wanted to highlight the flavor of the fresh tomatoes.

This tomato soup is so easy and delicious. I grow basil in the summer to add to the soup. Make some delicious grilled cheese sandwiches to go with it and you‚Äôve got a fantastic meal. Thank you, Ina!

At our local farmers market I found a 10 lb. box of ‚Äúmust go‚Äù tomatoes for $4. The tomatoes were BEAUTIFUL. I tried this recipe. I used 4-5 lib. Adjusted the ingredients and it turned out amazing! I froze 2 quarts for a cold winters night. It was completely farm to table with herbs from my garden. I didn‚Äôt mill the soup so, I‚Äôm sure, me consistency was far different from Ina‚Äôs. Still delish!
This recipe looks amazing. I was wondering if you can freeze it? I am doing a soup booth for our fair and need to make some large quantities.

Ina, you nailed it!  This is bsolutely, hands down, the best, easiest fresh tomato soup recipe.  I had already roasted tomatoes from my garden last summer and froze them.  They were perfect addition along with some fresh cherry tomatoes, fresh basil and thyme.  Vegetable broth is my go to since I‚Äôm pescatarian.  Thank you, Ina!

Thank you Ina! Finally the tomato soup that pairs amazing with a craved grill cheese sandwich but could stand alone as the appetizer on a night with a steak dinner. I am so happy I found this recipe. XOXO

P.S. Watch the video to understand what 4 cups of basil looks like.

I did mix some Campari tomatoes in to get to 3lbs of Roma tomatoes.

I‚Äôm not quite sure what to say about this. Looking at the reviews I was so ready for a yummy tomato soup to go with our provolone, salami,copacolla  Stromboli.  I wondered why the one and two star people didn‚Äôt comment and now I think I know why. Followed directions to a T. I‚Äôve done Ina‚Äôs roasted tomatoes before and loved them. I wish I had lined my sheet pan with foil to begin to avoid the very dirty sticky pan. I expected more flavor from this. My basil was fresh out of the garden but my thyme was dried but a new jar. My stock was not homemade and I‚Äôm thinking beef stock next time (I will try again).  Should have done some julienned basil garnish, I guess. Used my immersion blender which worked fine. We didn‚Äôt have an issue with stringy peel. Wouldn‚Äôt you lose flavor by removing before making the soup?  I liked the idea of roasting the onions with the tomatoes.  And, I‚Äôm thinking a slower roast at a lower temperature might bring out more flavor.  We live in the tropics and I hope this will make a good Sumer soup.
So good and very tasty
Wonderful.  Making it for a second time.  Will try it during the summer as a cold soup.
Love this soup-easy to make and wonderful flavor.  Added to our soup favorites!

Absolutely delicious!  Roasted tomatoes on the vine for about an hour with convection for the last 15 minutes.  Come out nice and browned.  So much flavor.  Used 28 oz can of tomato pur√©e and a big handful of garlic.  Was going to use immersion blender, but we like chunky soup so I opted to use a potato masher.  It worked great!  Had with brioche grilled cheese sandwiches.  Will definitely make this again!
4 cups of basil seems excessive. Do you have any idea what basil cost?
Delicious soup.  Thank you Ina
Creamy comfort food that is perfect for a cold winter day with a grilled cheese sandwich.  Love it!
Loved it! Don't be afraid to add a little extra crushed red pepper to spice it up! Absolutely delicious!!!
Very good. A hit with my family.  I chose low sodium chicken stock to help reduce the sodium.

Fantastic, everything from scratch! Made Ina‚Äôs cream of tomato recipe too.
Also fantastic!
Great recipe.   My family loved it
This recipe is one of my staples with some grilled cheese sandwiches on brioche bread! It‚Äôs delicious and my whole family loves it.

At Grammy‚Äôs house, this is called Hazel Basil tomato soup :-) in honor of a four-year-old who loves tomato soup but has a milk allergy. Since I often find her pulling my basil leaves and eating them in my garden, this is the perfect recipe for her. She loves it and the freezer is stocked :-)
Absolutely love this soup! It is easy to make and taste delicious.¬†

Delicious tomato soup, the basil and thyme along with roasting the tomatoes makes an amazing difference to "homemade " tomato soup. Grew extra basil and Roma tomatoes this year to be able to make extra to freeze. Froze a few servings last year and definitely plan to freeze more!
Thanks Ina! A keeper for sure.
Amazing and easy
Excellent soup!!
Recipes to hard to find
I'm not sure which recipe I like better. Ina's Roasted Leek and Potato Soup or this one the Roast Tomato & Basil. Both are fantastic.
This is so good. I

This is the best tomato soup I have ever had, yet alone made! Rave reviews by all who ate it. There‚Äôs something about roasting tomatoes that is very comforting. I was afraid the 4 packed cups of basil might be too much but it was perfect! Today is the second time for me to make it and it will be awesome with grilled cheese sandwiches. I always count on Ina to have some of the best recipes around. Thanks Ina.

I made this this weekend, it was really good.¬† Didn't have the pepper flakes, so used cajun spice mix instead.¬† It went together pretty easily, and was delicious.¬† I'm wondering if i grilled the tomatoes if that would give it a smokier flavor?¬† Might have to try it.

This recipe is the BEST! This past winter I made a double batch & canned it¬† (water bath). It's March & now I am doing it again! This is a little effort, but so worth it! Doing this works great for my husband & I. We can have this soup any day that we want! It's on the shelf!

This recipe is easy enough to make on a week night. I made this for my family tonight and it came out amazing!!! I followed the recipe exactly except I omitted the butter for food allergy reasons. It was delicious!!!  I don‚Äôt have a food mill so I used a blender, and I think the texture came out just right! The whole family loved it, and my husband already said he is going to want it again. My daughter even liked it enough to finish her bowl. The closest she normally gets to tomatoes is eating ketchup. This is a fantastic recipe! Thanks Ina!!!
Absolutely delicious and flavorful. It packs huge flavor for a recipe with such simple ingredients. I opted for less chicken stock and more water for less sodium and it was still so good!
Always a hit!¬† I have made this many times and served to company with rave reviews.¬† I finish each bowl with a swirl of basil flavored basil as well as a garnish of fresh basil.¬†¬†

I just finished eating this and am back to print the recipe - my entire family agreed that this was an amazing soup. I was looking for a tomato basil soup that didn't have any milk/cream and I can honestly say that I didn't even miss it. I did add 1 Tbsp of sugar, as suggested by another comment...but I followed everything else exactly. Thanks Ina!
So easy & SO delicious!
This soup tastes amazing . We all loved it
Made this several times always amazingly delicious! I added a touch of half and half for a more creamy texture.‚ù§Ô∏è
We love this!  I used an immersion blender and it worked perfectly!  My kids ask for it! Thanks so much!

I must admit, I was a little worried when I discovered I didn‚Äôt have a food mill. As suggested by other reviewers, I used my immersion blender and removed the skins of the baked tomatoes prior to adding to the soup. Also added some honey and topped with crumbled leftover bacon! The consistency is a little too thin for my taste so may add a little heavy cream next time¬†
Absolutely delicious! Cooked tomatoes longer and didn‚Äôt add thyme (don‚Äôt care for it).
Delicious!  I only had one pound of fresh tomatoes, but it was still fantastic.

This is the best tomato-basil soup I've ever eaten! It is absolutely delicious, low calorie, and even with store-bought tomatoes has so much flavor! I will be making this again, but next time I think I'll use my stick blender instead of the food mill. I threw away so much of the coarser ingredients that just refused to go through the mill.. :(
Spectacular!
This is really good.

video.name: Roasted Tomato Basil Soup
video.description: Ina's roasted tomato basil soup is a rich, healthy alternative to canned.
